bookTitle: The Year My Sister Got Lucky
Plot: In this hilarious, heartrending novel, New York Times bestselling author Aimee Friedman reminds us of the importance of sisters. . . and of not wearing stilettos in the mud. When Katie and Michaela Wilder are uprooted from NYC and planted in rural Fir Lake, Katie is horrified by their new surroundings: the too-friendly neighbors, the local uniform of sandals paired with socks, the very idea of milking a cow. But while Katie suffers through shopping withdrawal, Michaela transforms into a small-town social firefly, flirting with the hot quarterback and soaking up nature with her new hick-town friends. As in, people who think camping is *fun*. Does Katie even know her sister anymore? And after Michaela hides a jaw-dropping secret from her, does Katie even want to?
Characters: Katya 'Katie' Wilder, Michaela Wilder, Autumn Hawthorne, Anders Swensen, Jasper Hawthorne, Sullivan Turner
Setting: New York City, New York (United States), Essex County, New York (United States)
